snippet: "Lysistrata Jones" will have played 34 preview performances and 30 regular performances when it closes on Sunday.
abstract: "Lysistrata Jones" will have played 34 preview performances and 30 regular performances when it closes on Sunday.
lead_paragraph: "Lysistrata Jones," the new Broadway musical about a college basketball team that brought dribbling, passing, and hoop shots to the Walter Kerr Theater, will close after the Jan. 8 matinee performance, the producers announced on Tuesday, following two months of weak ticket sales. The show opened on Dec. 14 to a mix of positive and negative reviews from critics, and it failed to develop a following despite the relative lack of new original musicals on Broadway last fall, with some ticket sales agents saying that the title - a modern-day twist on the classic Greek play - was off-putting to some potential theatergoers and tourist groups. (The only other original musical to open on Broadway during the fall season, "Bonnie & Clyde," received worse reviews and closed on Friday.)
